's message to Muslims: ‘Roads not meant for namaz; learn from Maha Kumbh’

Hindu festivals like Diwali & Maha Kumbh Mela likely cause more traffic trouble in India due to massive processions, shopping rushes, & travel, e.g., a 300 km jam during Kumbh. Muslim festivals like Eid al-Fitr see congestion near mosques & travel peaks, but it’s more localized.

India has become a nation perpetually stuck in traffic Jam. In cities like Hyderabad, traffic congestion is relentless—except for the brief window between 1 AM and 3 AM, the roads remain choked at all hours. This isn't just Hyderabad; Delhi, Mumbai, Chennai, Bangalore, Pune—

Rohtas, Bihar: Heavy traffic congestion on Sasaram National Highway is causing long delays, with 2 km taking 3-4 hours. Pilgrims travelling to and from Prayagraj Maha Kumbh are stranded for hours facing severe inconvenience due to the jam

Maha Kumbh rush triggers one of India’s biggest traffic jams; pilgrims stranded in 300 km traffic jam.The congestion was caused by the massive influx of pilgrims travelling to the Maha Kumbh Mela in Prayagraj, Uttar Pradesh, turning highways into endless parking lots.
